metadata.synopsis:
The player encounters Shadowheart sheltering in the Druid Grove. When we find her, she seems greatly preoccupied with a strange githyanki artefact. She may join our party after we speak to her, but needs more convincing in the case that gith are present.
Note: Much of this scene plays out in a similar manner to Shadowheart's previous recruitment opportunity closer to the site of the nautiloid crash - we can find her at the druid grove if we advance forwards without recruiting her - she makes her own way to the grove off screen. We may have met her previously, in which case she's suspicious as to why we keep bumping into one another. We may even have been forced to abandon her during our earlier escape from the ship - something she'll recall bitterly. Shadowheart is particularly reluctant to deal with gith players - they were her enemies during her prior secret mission to steal the strange artefact, though the player will not know this yet
metadata.how_to_trigger: goto 284.28, 1.49, 302.48Talk to ShadowHeartSelect option 3. You were kidnapped by those creatures as well?Select option 3. Calm down. We escaped - we survived. There's no need for dramatics.Select option 2. I doubt this is the only entrance. You could look elsewhere.Select option 4. I'm leaving before more things crawl out of the wreckageiin recon "goto 220.91, 30.62, 407.16"Trigger Plea at the gates in recon "killcombat"in recon "goto 218.14, 25.97, 539.96"Interact with Shadowheart

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: I thought I made myself clear last time - lose the other gith, or there's nothing more to say.
24.context: InternalNodeContext: Player is a githyanki who saved SH during the tutorial, but SH is reluctant to join the party as Lae'zel is present.

74.speaker: Shadowheart
74.text: Are you the one I should actually be speaking to?

163.speaker: Narrator
163.text: *Suddenly you are pulled into her mind. You feel her frustration, caution, determination.*

350.speaker: Shadowheart
350.text: ...Yes, you're the one. I felt it. I'm told you want company on the journey ahead.

139.speaker: Shadowheart
139.text: The name's Shadowheart, by the way.

121.speaker: Shadowheart
121.text: I can't afford to stay here forever. Time isn't on my side - or yours, for that matter.
121.context:
InternalNodeContext: Hasmet if the player saved SH aboard the nautiloid, but did not revive her on the beach, then spoke to her in the den without recruiting her.
Not applicable if the player failed to convince SH to join a party that included gith (in that case, N776 is applicable)

123.speaker: Shadowheart
123.text: I told you already - I want to speak to whoever's really in charge.
123.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. She's decided there's someone more important she should be dealing with.

165.speaker: Shadowheart
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH is seated on a boulder, turning over the gith artefact in her hands.NodeContext: Sitting on a boulder, murmuring to herself while trying to figure out a mysterious puzzle box relic.(the item is approx the size of a rubik's cube. She turns it over in both hands, looking for a opening or clue). She is not yet aware of the player.

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *Her attention is consumed by an engraved box that she turns over in her hands.*
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angle on the box in her hands

186.speaker: Narrator
186.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer on the box, showing some of its detail.

331.speaker: Narrator
331.text: *The box is inscribed with glyphs similar to those used by the githyanki.*
331.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer on the box, showing some of its detail.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: A githyanki artefact - how did you come by that?

32.speaker: Shadowheart
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and standsNodeContext: To gith players: a note of hostility. To others: surprise. In both cases, she's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

180.speaker: Player
180.text: My kin's heirlooms are not to be pawed at by the likes of you.

278.speaker: Shadowheart
278.text: What...? You... you're one of them - the ones who were attacking the ship.
278.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and standsNodeContext: A note of hostility to a gith player. She's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

388.speaker: Player
388.text: She was on the nautiloid, trapped in a pod. Greet her.

167.speaker: Shadowheart
167.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and stands

292.speaker: Shadowheart
292.text: You tried to free me. I couldn't get out until after the ship crashed -

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Confusion. Resolve. And a hint of gratitude.*
98.context: InternalNodeContext: The mind meld narration will only play if the player hasn't met Astarion, Wyll and Lae'zel (ie they haven't experienced many of these companion mindmelds yet)

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: ...Agh! Did you feel that? You've got the same thing I do - in your head.
52.context: NodeContext: Discomfort and surprise following an involuntary psychic swap. She realises she and the player have the same problem.

57.speaker: Shadowheart
57.text: You're no gith, at least. I could tell from being in your head.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: You're not fond of gith, I see.

359.speaker: Shadowheart
359.text: And you are? Those dragon-riding reavers tried to kill us.

328.speaker: Shadowheart
328.text: Forget it. I've bigger problems than your poor choice of disguises. We both do.

230.speaker: Player
230.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

311.speaker: Shadowheart
311.text: There must be a way to reverse what those tentacled freaks did.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Did you just experience the same swap as me?

3.speaker: Shadowheart
3.text: The same. It must be a side effect from what those tentacled freaks did to us.

288.speaker: Shadowheart
288.text: There has to be a way to get rid of these parasites.

103.speaker: Shadowheart
103.text: I need to find a healer. As do you.

243.speaker: Player
243.text: We should join forces. Better odds of survival.

113.speaker: Shadowheart
113.text: Or just company for our final moments.

46.speaker: Shadowheart
46.text: But yes - you look like a better choice than a band of helpless refugees.

365.speaker: Shadowheart
365.text: I might've considered it... but your choice of company so far leaves a great deal to be desired.
365.context: NodeContext: 'Choice of company' refers to Lae'zel, who is already in the party.

155.speaker: Shadowheart
155.text: Get rid of the other gith. Then we can talk about helping each other.
155.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the player is githyanki (will only trigger in this flow if they saved SH during the tutorial and have Laezel in party here)NodeContext: Spoken to the player, referring to Lae'zel.

379.speaker: Lae'zel
379.text: I offer you cleansing. You'd cast it aside for this shka'keth?

151.speaker: Player
151.text: Why the hells should I get rid of Lae'zel just to satisfy you?

402.speaker: Shadowheart
402.text: Her kind can't be trusted - they just tried to kill us aboard that ship, after all.
402.context: NodeContext: Referring to Lae'zel and gith, but addressed to the player (Lae'zel may or may not be present)

199.speaker: Player
199.text: There must be a way for us to all work together.

271.speaker: Shadowheart
271.text: Must there? You wouldn't expect a wolf and a deer to find a way to work together.

2.speaker: Shadowheart
2.text: For your sake, you ought to nip this in the bud before she turns on you.
2.context: NodeContext: Conspiratorial. Referring to Lae'zel, but addressed to the player (Lae'zel may or may not be present)

370.speaker: Player
370.text: If you trust me, then trust my judgement. We can help each other - all of us.
370.context: InternalNodeContext: This node should only appear after N1018

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I saved you before, remember? The least you can do is trust my judgement.
116.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN only if SH was saved during the tutorial

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: All right, I'll come with you. I suspect you'll need someone watching your back.
81.context: NodeContext: Agreeing to join the player's group, though harbouring some reservations about Lae'zel

106.speaker: Player
106.text: We need each other. Besides, do you have any better prospects?

68.speaker: Player
68.text: If you play along for now, we can deal with the gith later.

173.speaker: Lae'zel
173.text: This one is trouble. Watch your back, as she's likely to stab it.
173.context: NodeContext: Suspicious. Speaking to the player re: shadowheart.

399.speaker: Shadowheart
399.text: ...This is a terrible idea. You know that, yes?
399.context: NodeContext: Starting to come round, despite reservations,

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: But I suppose you may have your uses. I can keep an eye on the gith.

333.speaker: Shadowheart
333.context: InternalNodeContext: Node skipped if SH introduced herself aboard the nautiloid

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Introduce yourself as Gale and incline your head: ladies first.
48.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: Lae'zel. Daughter of Gith. Warrior of Vlaakith.
189.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'm Wyll, the Blade of Frontiers. Living legend, in the flesh!
35.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

310.speaker: Shadowheart
310.text: Uh-huh... Wyll it is then. Let's move.

347.speaker: Player
347.text: I'm known as the Blade of Frontiers - but you can call me Wyll.
347.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

77.speaker: Player
77.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

147.speaker: Player
147.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

249.speaker: Shadowheart
249.text: Very funny. And I'm a bugbear. We'll get along just fine.

111.speaker: Player
111.context: InternalNodeContext: TUT_TransformChamber_State_Introductions done sets when the player and SH exchange names during the tutorial. Option for introduction here only present if it wasn't done before.

268.speaker: Shadowheart
268.text: Wait. Perhaps we shouldn't. You're not the one I need to talk to, are you? Not really.

284.speaker: Shadowheart
284.text: I saw it, in your head. You follow someone else's orders. I'll deal with them, not you.
284.context: NodeContext: Knowing. She's referring to information she gleaned from a psychic connection.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: Wait - after all that, you won't join me?

265.speaker: Shadowheart
265.text: Oh I'll join you. If you have whoever's in charge alongside you. Otherwise, I'd best be on my way.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'll find someone you can deal with.

371.speaker: Shadowheart
371.text: You do that. I'll be here - for now.

383.speaker: Player
383.text: I've changed my mind. I'll take my chances without you.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: Fine, see what chance brings you. Perhaps we'll meet again. If you survive, that is.

146.speaker: Shadowheart
146.text: A bit crowded, don't you think? You'll need to swap out someone if you want me.

387.speaker: Player
387.text: All right. Meet me at camp.

363.speaker: Player
363.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.

307.speaker: Narrator
307.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

203.speaker: Astarion
203.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
203.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

263.speaker: Player
263.text: Gale could do with a rest.

105.speaker: Gale
105.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

358.speaker: Shadowheart
358.text: Take your time, my friend! Boo shall snooze a while longer.

293.speaker: Shadowheart
293.text: You seem overburdened with hangers-on already. You'll just slow me down.

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Make your way to my camp. I'll see you there.

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: See me when you've cut the dead weight.

397.speaker: Shadowheart
397.text: Before we go, I wanted to thank you, for freeing me aboard the nautiloid.
397.context: InternalNodeContext: SH joins party on this node rather than the endnode to facilitate approval change on the next node.

319.speaker: Shadowheart
319.text: It would've been all too easy for you to run right past my pod, but you didn't. I'll remember that.

309.speaker: Player
309.context: InternalNodeContext: Option unavailable if the player asked about SH's odd name before

317.speaker: Shadowheart
317.text: After everything you've been through, my name gives you pause? Please.
317.context: NodeContext: Exasperation. Where's this person's priorities?

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Fine. Let's talk about something else.

367.speaker: Player
367.text: So, what were you doing before you got caught up in this mess?

389.speaker: Shadowheart
389.text: That... is none of your business. Let's just concentrate on survival, yes?
389.context: NodeContext: Clams up and shifts the conversation. There's more here that she's not willing to divulge just yet.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Have it your way. Time to get moving.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: What do you know about these parasites we've been saddled with?

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Very little. Supposedly those monsters breed by planting their tadpoles in people's heads.
84.context: NodeContext: She's no expert, but she's heard stories.

334.speaker: Shadowheart
334.text: Over time, the infected victim turns into a mind flayer.
334.context: NodeContext: Explaining what she's heard and probably believed to be apocryphal until recently.

208.speaker: Shadowheart
208.text: I have no idea how long it takes, but I'd rather have a cure sooner than later.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: My kind are rare in this world. What do you know of us?

233.speaker: Shadowheart
233.text: I know enough to know I have to keep an eye on you.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: A name befitting the Underdark. Perhaps you have a little drow blood in you.
176.context: InternalNodeContext: Option unavailable if the player asked about SH's odd name before

255.speaker: Shadowheart
255.text: My blood is the least part of me, drow.
255.context: NodeContext: Teasing brush-off to a drow's flirtation. She doesn't care too much about her race.

217.speaker: Lae'zel
217.text: I heard you. So now hear me: raise a single hand against me, and I will slice it clean off.
217.context: NodeContext: Angry. Speaking about the player and Shadowheart's apparent intentions to ditch her once she proves a liability.

120.speaker: Shadowheart
120.text: Save your breath - I'm going nowhere with you as long as you have that gith in tow.

377.speaker: Player
377.text: This is ridiculous. We're done here.

221.speaker: Shadowheart
221.text: Go on, then. Just don't be surprised when your friend turns on you.

410.speaker: Player
410.text: I'm not going to just abandon my companion on a whim.

323.speaker: Shadowheart
323.text: Fine, put your faith in a marauding freak. Just do it away from me.
323.context: NodeContext: Referring to Lae'zel, but addressed to the player (Lae'zel may or may not be present)

168.speaker: Player
168.text: Why accept the company of one gith but not another?

228.speaker: Shadowheart
228.text: You helped me - I think I can trust you. But her? She's trouble.

339.speaker: Shadowheart
339.text: Get rid of the gith. Then we can talk about helping each other.
339.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player, referring to Lae'zel.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: If we survived the crash, there might be others. Found any?

404.speaker: Shadowheart
404.text: No, but I haven't looked either. Staying alive kept me busy.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: There has to be someone around this place who can help us.

380.speaker: Shadowheart
380.text: This grove is the home of the druid Halsin. Apparently he's a reputed healer.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: He could probably help us. If only he hadn't gone missing.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Ask about the strange artefact again.

415.speaker: Player
415.text: What was that artefact you were playing with before?

395.speaker: Player
395.text: Why do you have a githyanki heirloom?

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Tell me what you're doing with a gith artefact - the truth this time.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Seems you're lucky to have survived. What brings you here?

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: Same as you, I suppose. Looking for shelter, supplies...

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: ...but I think we both know what we really need. Someone who can help with the stowaways in our skulls.

218.speaker: Shadowheart
218.text: A healer, in short. Skilled. Discreet.

372.speaker: Narrator
372.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Anger. Bitterness. A will to survive.*
372.context: InternalNodeContext: The mind meld narration will only play if the player hasn't met Astarion, Wyll and Lae'zel (ie they haven't experienced many of these companion mindmelds yet)

336.speaker: Shadowheart
336.text: ...Agh! You've got one of those things in your head too. Can't run away from that.
336.context: NodeContext: Discomfort and surprise following an involuntary psychic swap. She realises she and the player have the same problem.

305.speaker: Player
305.text: There's nothing I could have done. I had to save myself.

235.speaker: Shadowheart
235.text: How would you know? You didn't even try.
235.context: NodeContext: Not letting the player of the hook for abandoning her.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: I don't know what you mean.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: You know. You looked me right in the eyes, then left me.
104.context: NodeContext: Not letting the player of the hook for abandoning her.

408.speaker: Lae'zel
408.text: You'd have proven a burden. Do not pretend you wouldn't have done the same.

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: I'm not the coward here, flatface.
92.context: NodeContext: Sharp dismissal, spoken to Lae'zel (who interjected to justify the player's earlier abandonment of SH)

304.speaker: Shadowheart
304.text: No matter. We both survived, for now.
304.context: NodeContext: Moving past her anger at being abandoned to more pragmatic matters.

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: Their duty was survival. You'd have done the same - do not pretend otherwise.

140.speaker: Shadowheart
140.context: NodeContext: Sharp dismissal, spoken to Lae'zel (who interjected to justify the player's earlier abandonment of SH)

78.speaker: Player
78.text: That swap we just experienced - what was it?

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: Remember those things they put in our heads before you abandoned me? That's what.

187.speaker: Shadowheart
187.text: I'm looking for a cure - starting in this place.

252.speaker: Player
252.text: You survived - let it go. Now what are you doing here?

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: Keen to change subject, are you? You weren't so interested last time I tried to get your attention.
73.context: NodeContext: Not quite etting the player of the hook for abandoning her.

239.speaker: Shadowheart
239.text: I thought I might find shelter, supplies - even a healer, perhaps.

257.speaker: Shadowheart
257.text: What...? You... you're one of them - the ones who were attacking the ship.
257.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and standsNodeContext: A note of hostility to a player who looks like a gith. She's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and standsNodeContext: To gith players: a note of hostility. To others: surprise. In both cases, she's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

260.speaker: Narrator
260.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Distrust. Hostility. Because you are gith.*
260.context: CinematicNodeContext: The mind meld narration will only play if the player hasn't met Astarion, Wyll and Lae'zel (ie they haven't experienced many of these companion mindmelds yet)

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: ...Agh! No, you were on the ship, captive. I can feel the parasite in your head.
26.context: InternalNodeContext: Checking for Gith tag on this node as the previous answer may be skippedNodeContext: Discomfort and surprise following an involuntary psychic swap. She realises she and the player have the same problem.

361.speaker: Shadowheart
361.text: And you ran away as I recall. Left me to die, trapped in that pod.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: Well, now you can run away again, gith. Keep away from me.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: We're facing the same problem - is that truly all you have to say?

374.speaker: Shadowheart
374.text: I can throw in a few more choice insults if you insist, but I'd rather you just left.

394.speaker: Shadowheart
394.text: I've seen your kind's handiwork. And I won't fall victim to it.
394.context: NodeContext: 'Your kind' being gith. She's had prior dealings with them that ended violently,

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'm not with the gith who attacked the ship. You know that already.

346.speaker: Shadowheart
346.text: Maybe I have other reasons. Regardless, stay away from me.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I won't come any closer. Let's just talk.

15.speaker: Lae'zel
15.text: Why bother with chatter? Our cure is at the crèche.

248.speaker: Lae'zel
248.text: We can simply return in a few days, and take the box from the shell of her corpse.

13.speaker: Shadowheart
13.text: No. It doesn't matter. I wouldn't trust your kind if a truth spell was stitched into your tongue.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I saved you, aboard the ghaikh ship. You owe me your trust.
39.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH was saved during the tutorial

385.speaker: Player
385.text: Lae'zel is right. A gith crèche might help.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The parasite is the real threat. We should be helping each other.

277.speaker: Shadowheart
277.text: All right... say we found some miniscule patch of common ground... what then?

384.speaker: Player
384.text: Then we focus on surviving - together.

210.speaker: Shadowheart
210.text: I suppose you gith know something about these things...

244.speaker: Shadowheart
244.text: Fine. But understand that I'll cut you loose the moment I have to.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Change your mind and attack her.

137.speaker: Shadowheart
137.text: Foolish. This whole place is on edge. Cause trouble and they'll turn on you - the outsider.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: This is foolish. We should be focused on solving our shared problem.

341.speaker: Shadowheart
341.text: I've seen how your kind solves problems - with swords and dragonfire.

273.speaker: Player
273.text: I suggest you hold your tongue before I slice it out.

338.speaker: Shadowheart
338.text: Lay one finger on me and you'll breath your last. I promise.

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: Everyone watch out - they've gone mad!

314.speaker: Shadowheart
314.text: I don't care what you have to say, gith. Back off.

342.speaker: Player
342.text: It's too risky to turn your back on her. Attack.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Keep goading me, and I will kill you.

366.speaker: Player
366.text: Keep it up and you'll wish you died on that nautiloid.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: Try teaching me some manners then. See what it gets you.
36.context: NodeContext: Calling the player's bluff. 'You want to fight me? Then do it'

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Wait. We can just talk without going for each other's throats.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Tell her it'll be a short lesson, then attack.

403.speaker: Shadowheart
403.text: Unless you're going to say 'I'll be leaving', I'm not interested.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You're a fiery one. We'd make a formidable pair.

324.speaker: Player
324.text: And if I don't - what are you going to do about it?

360.speaker: Shadowheart
360.text: Not me - this place. It's on edge. If I raise the alarm, everyone will turn on you - the outsider.
360.context: NodeContext: A threat to wreaponize bystanders. Gesturing at her surrounds on 'this place'. She knows that if the player starts trouble here, they'll run afoul of the druid grove's inhabitants.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You can always leave if I intimidate you.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Change your tone, before you regret it.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Tell me what you're doing with that artefact belonging to my people.

152.speaker: Shadowheart
152.text: Some crude scratches in the metal doesn't make it yours.

143.speaker: Shadowheart
143.text: Stay out of my business, and stay away from me.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I'm going to stay right here, just to spite you.

232.speaker: Shadowheart
232.text: No matter. Walk away, gith. We have nothing to discuss.

369.speaker: Narrator
369.text: *Suddenly you see what she sees. Feel what she feels. Distrust. Hostility. Because you look like a gith.*
369.context: InternalNodeContext: The mind meld narration will only play if the player hasn't met Astarion, Wyll and Lae'zel (ie they haven't experienced many of these companion mindmelds yet)

396.speaker: Shadowheart
396.text: ...Agh! You... you were on the ship. You have one of those things as well...
396.context: NodeContext: Discomfort and surprise following an involuntary psychic swap. She realises she and the player have the same problem.

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: ...why are you disguised as a gith, idiot? I could've killed you.

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *Suddenly you're in her head, feeling what she feels - confusion. Frustration. Resolve.*
107.context: InternalNodeContext: The mind meld narration will only play if the player hasn't met Astarion, Wyll and Lae'zel (ie they haven't experienced many of these companion mindmelds yet)

378.speaker: Shadowheart
378.text: Agh! You... you were on the ship  - and you have one of those things as well.
378.context: NodeContext: Discomfort and surprise following an involuntary psychic swap. She realises she and the player have the same problem.

141.speaker: Shadowheart
141.text: Agh! You... you were on the ship  - and you have one of those things as well.
141.context: NodeContext: Discomfort and surprise following an involuntary psychic swap. She realises she and the player have the same problem.

191.speaker: Shadowheart
191.text: I suppose you came here for the same reason I did...
191.context: NodeContext: She knows they both have the same problem - the tadpole.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: Oh yes? Maybe you suppose too much.

204.speaker: Shadowheart
204.text: I don't think so. You need a healer, same as I do.

375.speaker: Player
375.text: I'm here for anything that helps me stay alive. Shelter, supplies... allies.

240.speaker: Shadowheart
240.text: Of course, but what you really need - what both of us need - is a healer.

87.speaker: Shadowheart
87.text: Precisely. We need some who can help rid us of these things.

355.speaker: Shadowheart
355.text: But we'll have no such luck in this place, from what I've learned of it.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: I could crack open that little thing with one fist, if you want.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: I didn't ask for you to -
101.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and standsNodeContext: To gith players: a note of hostility. To others: surprise. In both cases, she's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

315.speaker: Shadowheart
315.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the boxNodeContext: To gith players: a note of hostility. To others: surprise. In both cases, she's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *The box is inscribed with strange glyphs that mean nothing to you.*
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer on the box, showing some of its detail.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: What's that trinket you have there?

276.speaker: Shadowheart
276.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart quickly puts away the box and standsNodeContext: To gith players: a note of hostility. To others: surprise. In both cases, she's interrupted at the end of this node (by an involuntary psychic swap with the player)

169.speaker: Shadowheart
169.text: I thought I'd seen the last of you.
169.context: NodeContext: She met the player before - it didn't end on good terms.

348.speaker: Shadowheart
348.text: Start another fight, and I'll finish it.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Take it easy. I'm not looking to fight you again.

126.speaker: Shadowheart
126.text: Then what are you looking for? Because it seems like you're following me.

368.speaker: Shadowheart
368.text: If I wanted a tail, I'd kill a cat.
368.context: NodeContext: Throwaway dark humour. 'I don't like being followed'. SH standing

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I have more important things to do than follow you - surviving, for one.

327.speaker: Player
327.text: It's just a coincidence - I'm not following you.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: I've heard of cats. They are not worthy prey, even for the likes of you.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I do not know what this 'cat' is, but I doubt you'd fare well against any beast.

70.speaker: Shadowheart
70.text: It's a hypothetical. At present, I have no particular need to kill a cat.
70.context: NodeContext: Assorted lines responding to the player reacting to her 'if I wanted a tail, I'd kill a cat line'. Clarifying it was just a figure of speech,

298.speaker: Shadowheart
298.text: So again - what are you doing here?

33.speaker: Shadowheart
33.text: Fair point. Survival is the crux of it, for now.
33.context: NodeContext: Suspicion wanes. Accepting the player's explanation.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: The druids are supposed to be welcoming, and I could do with a little reprieve.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: Hmm. If you say so. Either way, there's still our little problem to contend with.
20.context: NodeContext: Suspicion wanes. Accepting the player's explanation.

362.speaker: Player
362.context: NodeContext: She's ready to fight, though it's avoidable.

318.speaker: Shadowheart
318.text: I thought I made myself clear last time - lose the gith, or there's nothing more to say.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Forget about Lae'zel. I sent her on her way.

306.speaker: Shadowheart
306.text: Hmm... I suppose we can talk some more then.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: You should reconsider. Wasting time here isn't doing much for you.

290.speaker: Shadowheart
290.text: There's nothing for me to reconsider - you're the one with the questionable company.

325.speaker: Shadowheart
325.text: I thought I made myself clear last time, gith - keep away from me.

312.speaker: Player
312.text: You show admirable spirit. We should be work together.

376.speaker: Shadowheart
376.text: Just because you say it doesn't mean it's so. Now back off.

326.speaker: Shadowheart
326.text: You're alive! I woke up by the wreckage, surrounded by corpses. I was starting to think I was the only survivor.
326.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart stands, quickly putting the box away.InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player rescued SH from her pod on the nautiloid, but subsequently left her unconscious at the crash site.NodeContext: Surprised, and not displeased to see the player

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Things turned heated between us, back on the nautiloid. You don't have hard feelings?

332.speaker: Shadowheart
332.text: I haven't forgotten what happened between us, but I also haven't forgotten I'd still be trapped in that pod if it wasn't for you. Let's call it even - we both have bigger concerns.
332.context: NodeContext: Player attacked SH during the tutorial after freeing her, but now she's willing to let it go.

67.speaker: Shadowheart
67.text: Of course. I'd be stuck in a pod - or  worse - if it wasn't for you. Glad to see you're all right. Now maybe we can help one another.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: We might be clear of those monsters' ship, but we still have their spawn inside our heads. We need to get rid of them while we still can.

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I'm surprised you made it this far by yourself.

279.speaker: Shadowheart
279.text: I'm not helpless. Once I came to, I set out to find some means of surviving: supplies, shelter... and a healer, of course.

409.speaker: Player
409.text: Seems you've got a head-start on me. What are you doing here?

193.speaker: Shadowheart
193.text: This was the first sign of friendly life I came across. I hoped I might find supplies, shelter... and a healer, of course.

351.speaker: Shadowheart
351.context: NodeContext: The player's returned to her after they recenty spoke.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: Spit it out. I won't wait around here forever.

136.speaker: Shadowheart
136.text: And no, I haven't found a cure for our little problem yet, if that's what you were going to ask.

420.speaker: Shadowheart
420.text: What are you doing here? Are you following me?
420.context: NodeContext: Stands up and approaches us, suspicious. We keep running into her.

253.speaker: Narrator
253.text: *She hastily tucks away an ornate box - one covered in strange symbols you don't understand.*
253.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH standingNodeContext: SH standing
